item.title: Metals Pause as Weak Chinese Demand Bites
item.description: Base metals prices held steady while gold was higher, as weak demand, especially from the Chinese property sector, diminishes sentiment.

item.title: UK Gilt Yields Fall After Weaker-Than-Expected Retail Sales Data
item.description: Gilt yields dropped after the U.K. retail sales data came in weaker than expected, potentially easing the pressure for more BOE interest-rate rises to tackle inflation.

item.title: Weak Equities, Rising US Bond Yields Could Lift Dollar
item.description: The euro is currently stuck in a range against the dollar around $1.09 but risk aversion, rising U.S. bond yields and a strengthening U.S. economy should cause the dollar to rise, Danske Bank said.

item.title: UK Retail Sales Fall More Than Expected
item.description: UPDATED: U.K. retail sales volumes ticked down 1.2% in July, as unseasonably wet weather in the month kept shoppers away.

item.title: India's Sensex Drops 0.3%, Dragged by Tech Stocks
item.description: Indian shares were lower early in the session, dragged by falls in tech stocks as concerns persist over policy tightening by the Reserve Bank of India and other central banks and their impact on the economy.

item.title: Tokyo Looks to the Sun to Power New Homes
item.description: The policy in one of the world’s largest cities is a test case for whether solar power makes sense on urban rooftops.

item.title: Walmart said its salesand profit grew in the most recent quarter, another sign that American consumers continue to spend on necessities such as food, and look for deals.
item.description: Walmart said its sales and profit grew in the most recent quarter, another sign that American consumers continue to spend on necessities such as food, and look for deals.

item.title: The average mortgage rate rose to 7.09%, its highest level in more than 20 years, according to data released by mortgage giant Freddie Mac, extending a stretch of high borrowing costs that has slowed the housing market.
item.description: The average mortgage rate rose to 7.09%, its highest level in more than 20 years, according to data released by mortgage giant Freddie Mac, extending a stretch of high borrowing costs that has slowed the housing market.

item.title: The Biden administration announced plans to impose new tariffs on can-making metal imported from China, Germany and Canada, a move food companies say could lead to higher prices for some canned foods.
item.description: The Biden administration announced plans to impose new tariffs on can-making metal imported from China, Germany and Canada, a move food companies say could lead to higher prices for some canned foods.

item.title: In a race to fix a nationwide reading crisis that worsened during the pandemic, more states are threatening to make students repeat third grade to help them catch up.
item.description: In a race to fix a nationwide reading crisis that worsened during the pandemic, more states are threatening to make students repeat third grade to help them catch up.

item.title: Starboard Value, which won a famous victory in a proxy fight with Darden Restaurants nearly a decade ago, now has Outback Steakhouse owner Bloomin' Brands in its sights.
item.description: Starboard Value, which won a famous victory in a proxy fight with Darden Restaurants nearly a decade ago, now has Outback Steakhouse owner Bloomin’ Brands in its sights.

item.title: Treasury yields continued to climb after the release of strong labor-market data, while stocks fell. The 10-year Treasury yield rose to 4.307%. The S&P 500 and Dow both slipped 0.8% and the Nasdaq shed 1.2%.
item.description: Treasury yields continued to climb after the release of strong labor-market data, while stocks fell. The 10-year Treasury yield rose to 4.307%. The S&P 500 and Dow both slipped 0.8% and the Nasdaq shed 1.2%.

item.title: Israel is selling its most advanced air-defense missile system to Germany, in a fresh sign of how the Ukraine war has created demand for weapons in Europe and fueled a boom for the Israeli arms industry.
item.description: Israel is selling its most advanced air-defense missile system to Germany, in a fresh sign of how the Ukraine war has created demand for weapons in Europe and fueled a boom for the Israeli arms industry.

item.title: Health insurer Blue Shield of California said it would jettison the complicated system that Americans use to pay for drugs, and create something that aims to be better, with partners including Amazon and the entrepreneur Mark Cuban.
item.description: Health insurer Blue Shield of California said it would jettison the complicated system that Americans use to pay for drugs, and create something that aims to be better, with partners including Amazon and the entrepreneur Mark Cuban.

item.title: Tesla cut as much as $10,000 off some Model S and Model X vehicles in China, after reducing the prices of two premium versions of its Model Y by up to 4.5%.
item.description: Tesla cut as much as $10,000 off some Model S and Model X vehicles in China, after reducing the prices of two premium versions of its Model Y by up to 4.5%.

item.title: Maui's Emergency Management Agency administrator, who was criticized for his handling of the wildfire disaster that tore through historic Lahaina, resigned.
item.description: Maui’s Emergency Management Agency administrator, who was criticized for his handling of the wildfire disaster that tore through historic Lahaina, resigned.

item.title: A cargo ship became the first civilian vessel to safely travel from Odesa to the southernBlack Sea, defying a Russian blockade of Ukraine's largest ports.
item.description: A cargo ship became the first civilian vessel to safely travel from Odesa to the southern Black Sea, defying a Russian blockade of Ukraine’s largest ports.

item.title: The EU's gas-storage levels are close to hitting their pre-winter target more than two months early, a boost for the bloc's economy after energy ties with Russia were all but severed last year following the invasion of Ukraine.
item.description: The EU’s gas-storage levels are close to hitting their pre-winter target more than two months early, a boost for the bloc’s economy after energy ties with Russia were all but severed last year following the invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Prosecutors in Colombia announced criminal indictments against 60 people, including dozens of former government officials, on graft charges tied to the transnational corruption scandal involving disgraced Brazilian contractor Odebrecht.
item.description: Prosecutors in Colombia announced criminal indictments against 60 people, including dozens of former government officials, on graft charges tied to the transnational corruption scandal involving disgraced Brazilian contractor Odebrecht.

item.title: Fox News is gearing up for the first Republican debate without knowing whether Trump will be on the stage.
item.description: Fox News is gearing up for the first Republican debate without knowing whether Trump will be on the stage.
